Yesterday evening at 9 I went there with my family, we took a full platter (4 person). Food was good, but I ordered a fried chicken as parcel along with the food left after we ate. After I get back home I found that all the fried chicken is not given along with the other foods. But I paid for it. They should be more careful about what they are getting paid and what they ate delivering.

Have tried their Signature Biriyani, and the Hydrabadi Biriyani too. Signature one tastes great, but I didn't like the hydrabadi one. Mutton of the biriyani was not well cooked, and I could get the raw smell of meat from that one. But the Signature one is a must try. Also their hospitality was A class, all of their staffs are well mannered. Also the interior is pretty much impressive. Price might seem a bit high comparing to others those serving traditional Indian food, but the quantity is well enough. They say the Indian dishes are single serving, but it seemed a bit much for a person to me. Next time I want to try their Chinese cuisine. Hope it will not be a disappointing one. P.S. Though15% service charge and VAT was not included with the price in their menu, for some reason it was not charged to me.

I tried their chicken cheesy burger, Mirzafar burger (chicken) and fries on 2 different occasions and have nothing negative to say. Although I tried only 3-4 burger joints in Dhaka, easy to say they are the best when it comes to price and taste. They are affordable and buy 2 get 1 free is the best deal out there!
One of the best Burger restaurant in Dhaka. #CaptainCook

I tried their Signature Beef and Bacon burger. It was absolutely amazing. Solid, well cooked beef patties topped with tender beef strips and the perfect balance of cheese and special sauce. Fresh lettuce, tomato slice and crisp buns made the experience even better. Captain Cook burger is my go-to burger place whenever I go to Shimanto Squire , Dhanmondhi. Please give them a try.

This is a great fast food place. I mean it. The food was great. Not too expensive. They have a very classy Burger on menu Like Mr.Pounder & Mr.Alexander. The food serving time was moderate even when it was crowded. I liked that when I asked for water, they also gave me glasses with water not only the bottle. I think they deserve 5 stars. Peace Captain Cook.

Captain Cook Dhaka is amazing! Honestly good service and has an unbelievable cheese chicken burger that you could die for and is an all round good restaurant for all ages.this is one of the best restaurants I could ever visit.

Comparing to the price the Double Quarter Pounder burger was so yuumy !!! They were humble enough to go to each table to ask if everything was okay. If you're hungry,on a budget and want to have a good bite of burger this is the place !

Captain Cook special Mr.Pounder beef is great with Jalapeno and garlic sauce. Patty was great. Juicy enough to make a mess. Spicy enough to make you cry. Place is nice for Hangouts. Chill ambient. Sky view is great. Price is 9/10 Worth the experience and the food.

Best burger in the town so far with relatively low price. The Original Fikamoli burger is so juicy and cheesy on the top. Delighted to have such good taste of burger in Shimanto Squire Dhanmondhi. Thank you Captain Cook.
Best burger in the town so far with relatively low price. The burger is so juicy and cheesy on the top. Delighted to have such good taste of burger in Dhanmondhi.

Their service is so fast. They are so polite with every customer. I visted their restaurant yestarday. They have respected me alot. Also give me a discount. I am so satisfied with their service. And, the burger was so delicious and juicy.. :) I would like suggest everyone to visit their restaurant..

The burgers are decently priced and are value for money. The Patty wasn't dry and was well marinated. Decent amount of cheese was there. Overall it was great. Would really like to try their other meals as well. Thank you Captain Cook.
Quality of food, service & environment wear great. Best place to pass some quality time with quality food.Visit this place, surely you'll love it.
Tried the signature Beef & Bacon burger and sandwiches, and I have to say I totally loved it :D Very ambient environment, good for hangouts and great food.

This place is my recent favorite. Love their Mr.Mirjafar Burger specially. Been there four times already for this. The staff's behavior is really good. Gonna visit again :) Thank you Captain Cook Restaurant.

We often go to Hakka Dhaka Baily Road and every time we go there we're always very pleased with their service. The quality of their food is excellent specially the mega platter, dumplings, hot wings and kulfi are mouth-watering delicious. Along with the food Hakka Dhaka Baily Road also has a very warm, friendly and inviting environment with excellent customer service. Specially I always appreciate Saim's service, who recently got promoted to branch manager. He has always pleased us a lot. Congratulations to him for his success, the staff working under him are also pretty good, Saim is managing his branch pretty well. Today Nahid's service also pleased us. It's an amazing restaurant with great food, me and my family love this place. Wishing them all the best.

I loved the mega platter; the beef soup and hakka corn soup too. Very delicious , different taste. A full platter is more than sufficient for 4 persons, 5 can also eat. Very reasonable price. The Dhanmondi location is also good, though narrow and noisy. Staffs are friendly.

Hakka- fusion of indian and chinese cuisine... And perhaps hakka dhaka is the most famous for serving hakka cuisine.... Orders their seafood platter and platter B... Wrapped prawn was certainly their blockbuster item and wantons played the Xavi role.... rice was decent but hakka noodles were bullshit... those were like noodles sold on carts! bbq crab should win the ballon d' or while steamed fish was may be the neymar of the platter! squid seemed to be paul pogba- overrated... chicken cashewnut was very good so the Szechuan prawns!!!

Yesterday we had the Happy Meal for Tk 499 and it was a very satisfying lunch. The spicy taste is what I liked most and the quantity was sufficient. The kulfi was excellent. We also ordered the Seafood Platter for 4 for takeaway. When we sat down to eat we found there wasn't enough food for all 4 of us. The fried rice, noodles, wrapped prawns and whole baked fish was sufficient but there wasn't enough crab and squid. After I called and complained to the Manager, he sent complementary dishes of each. I am impressed by his prompt action and good customer service. happy to see such professionalism. Keep up the good work!
Loved the wrapped prawn and beef.. The kulfi could be loved if it was with traditional good smell, did not like the horlicks flavor of kulfi
Food was awesome and authetic real taste of state art service

It was raining relentlessly. Hakka Dhaka rescued us from the boredom by sending their sumptuous food. The food is as always awesome but for the first time I experienced their delivery service which was beyond expectations. That was very cordial of you to go through all the hassle for us.
The taste of Hakka noodles & the prawn is unbelievable! ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
It was simply delicious!! Loved their platter and hope to be there soon!

One of the Best Eateries of Dhaka. Keep it up :)

Went to the dhanmondi branch.took platter A,every dish was good but the mongolian beef was to salty and tasted a little bitter.quantity of the rice was very less for two persons but after complaining they refilled that.liked the kulfi very much.good service and ambience.price can be a bit reasonable.overall liked it.best of luck!

Me and some of my friends had iftar here yesterday. First, I called up Hakka Dhaka Banani to make a reservation and they didn't answer my phone 5 times until someone picked up and hung up on me before I could even hear them! Then they started declining my calls after I called them again! (How rude!) I called them again with my home telephone line... And someone finally picked up and took the reservation. Unfortunately, all the tables inside were reserved and we had to sit ...outside. It's not that special outside... doesn't have a nice view or anything... just a bunch of plants to block the horrid view. And the people that usually sit there are smokers who have their iftar with a cigarette. My main problem was the noise outside. Cars were honking outside and it ruined the entire experience. My suggestion is that they should just convert that place into an indoor area. The food was alright... But a bit overpriced. The Ramadan platter was 4K for 4 people. I think for that amount, they could've thrown in some extra dishes. The noodles was just average... Everyone kept saying it was "cocola noodles" I hope they take notes and improve.

Great food! Loved the Ramadan platter. Service was good too (but needs improvement in certain areas). Overall, had a great time there with my friends and would recommend the place to anyone for a good iftar party with friends!
Best hakka food in town! Wrapped prawn, hakka noodle, they have the beat rice , hunan chicken, dry chilly beef etc all of their items are so good! Loved it!ï¿½
Really tasty food, though the price is high. Satisfactory service.
Lots of choices, reasonable prices, fresh food, Very helpful staff. Sure will be back again. Recommended

Went there with family of 7 adults and 3 kids with out reservation. Before visiting I confirmed about reservation and they confirmed, it's not required. In the evening, specially on weekends, it's pretty crowded. Very friendly and helpful stuffs. Ordered 2 jumbo platter and some additional from menu. I have been a regular at Hakka Dhaka ever since the very start of their venture with their small restaurant at Banani. Ever since the very beginning they realized the fact that they might be the "under-dog" of the industry which motivated them to provide the most superior value possible which kept me coming back time and again, but this favorite restaurant of mine disappointed me quite a bit the past couple of my visits. I believe that in order to maximize the value provided... to the customers, a good service is as crucial as good food. Even though their food remains to be fantastic, it's their service that continues to frustrate me. It really pains me to say this as one of the owners is a good acquaintance of mine but even though the management is absolutely top notch, their service providers (a.k.a. Waiters) has some of the most unsophisticated and un-professional attitude and this just keeps getting worse. It is not always possible for the management to engage the customers directly, hence it is these waiters who end up being the face of the restaurant and it is not a pretty face. Please do not take it as a sign of aggression but rather a constructive criticism from a fan of the place. I am posting this here instead of a third party forum (such as foodbank) in the hope that the management takes notice of this issue. Apologies for the rant. Regards, Faiz.

I had visited this place before, and the first time was satisfactory and for the price, they have a standard and likable menu. But as I'm writing this now there's a notable callousness from their part which can be something anyone is likely to face trouble with. I have had dinner with my family yesterday and took three of their current iftar platters alongside one sea food platter from their usual menu. The food was nothing special but it didn't lack taste either. The icecrea...m that was with the iftar platter was melted though. However, the issue that occured is when we were provided with the bill, the sea food platter stated 1597tk (vat excl.) This was startling for us as in all their menues it had 597tk written on it. When heading out we pointed it out and they merely apologised. My concern is that it is a restaurant's responsibility to correctly and accurately list down information of every item. The customers decide on a menu weighting down on both the price and food combined, an error such as this does not only put the customers at inconvenience but is mainly very misleading.

In a city of bricks and concretes, yesterday I chose to be at a place like "Triangle cafe" for Iftar. The place is situated just beside 3/a Dhanmondi lake, if you're a nature lover like me then its the perfect place for enjoying the soothing weather and gentle breeze of this monsoon. Triangle had two platers, one with a rice bowl and the other offering chowmein. Being a chowmein lover I ordered plater 2 and I have to agree the food was great in quality and sufficient in quantity for one. The BBQ chicken is a must try and also the kebab roll was juicy and spicy. The chowmein tasted perfectly seasoned. Both the platers are priced 450/- BDT all inclusive. I will recommend everyone who is looking for an escape out of this city sensationalism, Triangle is your place to feel the nature and enjoy a quality time with mouthwatering food.

A small cafe which is only accessible through a lakeside walkway in this city of concrete. Very nice place to chill and hangout with friends remaining close to nature. Try their grilled mushroom (ask to make it spicy), boti kebab and/or wraps. Their khichuri is pretty good as well. Chillers/shakes are must try!! Cheers!!

Very nice place to hangout with friends and family cause it is very close to our nature and far away from concrete life. after having our iftar, fortunately we were witness of a heavy rainfall and that was amazing experience. Their iftar platter was delicious. Their grilled mushroom was so good. I m loving it.

A small cafe which is only accessible through a lakeside walkway in this city of concrete. Very nice place to chill and hangout with friends remaining close to nature. Environment is way much good for hangout with friends. Lakeside soothing environment was good to enjoy. I appreciate the way management changed the seating arrangements for us, providing chairs instead of wooden tool (y) For Food- its 4.5/5 (Rice, bar b q chicken and mushrooms was delicious, but vegetables can be even better). So, there is a room for improvement. Ambiance, Environment & service- 5/5 without second thought. So, overall a happy customer :)

The cheese, Vermont Cheddar, adds the flavor it needs to, but could be more melted, although thatâ€™s a recurring problem with most burgers and the cheese that sits atop them in this city. The fries are delicious as well, golden, crispy and beautifully salty, what more do you want?

From my wandering of tasting a good, decent steak, I found my end to this journey in Bangladesh. They serve you the steak full of juicy, tender and gorgeous look. People from inside are friendly enough to give you the proper description of what you are going to have in your plate. I enjoyed every single bite of it. (y) to them. And surely, I would love to visit them again and again.
Best steak, served fresh. poutine was also very tasty.

Went there last Friday with my friend, got surprised a bit seeing such a small place. Upon arrival they waiter attended us with details of their menu as they prepare steaks in two types of Texas style with some deviations. We selected a Sirloin and Tomahawk, which were 300g and 500g. The truth is we were a bit skeptic about the weight they were mentioning but to our surprise they showed us the raw steaks that they were about to prepare for us. This was a nice touch. Liked the... way they ask customers approval for the cuts before preparing it as they were doing it for all the guests in other tables too. After waiting for around 30 mins, the steaks arrived. We ordered medium done and medium rare the steaks were exactly like we ordered. The medium rare Tomahawk tasted even better than my medium done Sirloin. Both the steaks had sof juicy center with flavorful seared crusts. Loved every bite of the tender steak till the end. The portion is quite hefty along with the sides of mashed potato and sautee vegetables. The sauces were nice compliment to the steak, would recommend their roast bacon glace for sure. This will be my steak place from now on for as long as they serve steaks like that.
Just love the place also the food. Can't wait to visit them more. Everyone is so friendly
Very good selection of steaks and very good staff!
One of the best steak I ever had in Dhaka. Done and Texture was perfect. Price is high, so is the size, 300 grams to fill your tum and tastebud. Mashed potato was great.
Great Steaks. Best part they showed the steak portions before grilling it. Quantity was good. definitely a place to try out.

First glimpse will depict a small cozy diner bustling with energy as I have been there at dinner time. Fortunately we got our seats as we reserved earlier that day through phone. Ordered a Ribeye and Sirloin which were 300g each as per menu and done in true Texas style, which I was a bit skeptic at first. Then to my surprise they bought the raw cut in front of us and asked if we liked the cut and marbling. This is something we never experience in any steakhouse before, no one... asks about marbling of the meat in any steakhouse so far I have visited in Bangladesh. I started loving the place form that moment as the Ribeye had very good marbling in it. Just after that they served us complementary corn soups which were good gesture from their behalf and it was good too. Had to wait nearly 25 mins before we got the food and my friend asked the waiter why it takes this long to serve, then we came to know about the smoking process. They actually smoke each and every steak with imported woodchips and when we asked if they could show us the woodchips they certainly did, mixture of dry Apple & Hickory woodchips! Finally the steaks arrived and wow, perfectly seared medium rare steaks with juicy slight red center and dark crust outside. The first bite actually depicted all about that smoking stuff and for real it felt like I having a real steak, which I have seen for so long in TLC and other TV shows. The perfect thickness, sides of mashed potato and amazing sauces, though I did not like to use sauce in steaks as they are supposed to be juicy for medium rare done and in this case it was. Their service was good too as the waiters were polite and knowledgeable. This is my new favorite place for steaks and would highly recommend if anyone is looking for thick cut juicy steaks in Dhaka.
Good food, nice place and great music. Definitely one of the best steak place in Dhaka.

The sauses enhanced the flavor of the steak. Price is a little bit expensive but I found it worthy when I tasted the steak...its size, tenderness erc. Overall its a good restaurant to visit.
Best place for steak. And the environment is amazing!!
Me and my friend absolutely loved their food! This is gonna be our next favourite place! ï¿½ I loved their service, behavior, place and all ..Keep it up ï¿½

A great collection of prime cuts. The sides were not all that good. I'll recommend the mushroom and grilled vegetables as sides. But hey need some serious work on doneness. We ordered two medium rare rib eyes. Although the cuts were nice and thick one was way too rare the other way too well done. The searing was good. The drinks were chilled. Appetizers were great. Will come again.
As a beef lover, I loved the steak and the steak loved me back

Well i never usually give reviews. But i thought if i dont review this place that would be very unfair to them. I had an amazing experience there. I loved their steak. It was juicy and spicy. A perfect steak i must say!
Great flavor, my steak was done perfectly and the service was good. Small, chilled place and worth the price!
I have only one sentence to write as a review! Best Steak in the town, Period! ï¿½ï¿½
It has to be the best steak place in Dhaka. The rib eye steak was done to perfection and the quality of the meat was sublime.
Great steaks, great service great environment. Felt a little cramped though, hope they will be expanding soon
I Went last week with my friend and tried their Ribeye. It was awesome. One of the best places in Dhaka for Steaks.
Good food, lovely ambience, warm hospitality...!!!

The food was good. Only one problem is that the place is too small. When there is a little bit more customers.. they became nervous... and made a little bit of mess while serving. The steak was good... I enjoyed the food
Loved their steak! It was fresh and nicely cooked. Very well behaved and nice. Will recommend it to others. Keep up the good work!

I visited the place with several colleagues yesterday for lunch. I had a mushroom stake. The stake was cooked to perfection. I really liked the food. Would love to go there again. One small thing is when the generator is on it makes noise which is a bit too much. They should find a way to minimize the sound inside the restaurant.
Excellent Food, Good service! Hope it stays always like this! :)

Taste I would give 7/10, Comparing the price the vegetables are less in amount. Accommodation is not up to standard to the Food Menu status and price. Washroom facility not OK. For Family and Ladies its a Hastel to use washroom out side of main place.

Had one of the best Steaks in town!! Tried the T-Bone and the Rib Eye and both were top notch. The ambience was soothing and the service was brilliant by the staffs to go with it. Would suggest it to any steak lover. Will definitely drop by again to try their other steaks.
Wonderful service and very friendly environment with a unique character to it! The food was super!! Definitely returning again! Keep it up!

To me this is by far the best steak serving restaurant here in BD. They know what they are doing and fulfills customers expectations. I have asked for rare cooked sirloin steak and it was delicious! Definitely I will visit wood house Grill again! :)
One of the best steakhouse in town ï¿½
Food was sooooooooo yammy & good. Best steak in town.loved the environment. Keep it up.

The best steak in Dhaka I had till nowï¿½ The Rib eye was absolutely mouth watering and also the mushroom dish. Super ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Taste 10/10 Service 10/10 Behavior 10/10 Everything was perfect. Best wishes for Woodhouse Grill. May they Excel now and forever in their steak journey.
Good foods ... I love this place and I'll come again this place with my family

It's 4.5/5 actually. I want to say "I loved it" but minute details are holding me back. "I really liked it!" aptly describes it. Flavorful, tender, almost perfectly cooked ribeye and sirloin (5/5 for those) but t-bone was on the dry side. All sauces were on point though. (I'd recommend the hollaindase, pepper and bacon glaze hands down.) This place is a refreshing and much needed whiff of fresh air in the Dhaka steak situation. Definitely worth a try. I'm definitely going back (for the sirloin ï¿½) Also, 5/5 for hospitality. ï¿½
prime rib was decent, though a little overdone. i'd come back.
Good food,taste is awsome.staff behavior also good

This was absolutely exceptional. I would go as far to say you won't get a better steak in Dhaka and the strawberry cola is a must try. Greeted by very pleasent and attentive staff with a very knowledgeable waiter giving suitable recommendations for the various cuts of steak. Presentation of the steak and other dishes were a great spectacle as got a completely different style of serving food. I found the quality of the meet to be top class in the city. Even much better than any star rated hotel. I really enjoyed my dinner at WOOD HOUSE GRILL and will absolutely will return again with my family.

The steak was fresh, tender and perfectly cooked while the sauces added a rich savoury flavour. The appetisers were delightfully different. With a friendly staff and a very cordial owner who personally checks up on the quality of food being served, Woodhouse Grill is a must visit for those who want to enjoy delicious steaks.

Went to Woodhouse Grill today. Already I had an Experience about the Steak in Bangladesh. So as usual with timid heart and boosted morale entered to the venue. Little small but neat and clean.....the employees are very cordial...soft spoken and well trained. They I have seen describing the customers in detail about the type of cut, dish and side dishes. I have met the owner little latter. He was also very cordial and helpful. To taste for the 1st time....I asked for a Pepper ...Steak and level of cooking I asked is Medium well done. I received the food and cut the piece of meat....the knife was smooth and I put the first piece in my mouth.....mmmmm....delicious.....but the cooking was Well Done. The owner observed my food and he was not satisfied with the cooking level, he returned my steak back and served another steak cooked in perfection as Medium Well Done. The incident depict how sincere and customer oriented they are. I am fully satisfied and wish to go frequently there. If the remain committed regarding their standard and customer satisfaction no doubt they will rise above the horizon....Viva Woodhouse Grill. I definitely recommend to taste the steak in Woodhouse Grill.
Awesome option for steak lovers - try out the west texan style steaks...:)
The steak is really good and so are the appetisers! They serve great portions of meat too. One small feedback, need to reduce the amount of pepper in the steak ï¿½ All in all, a big thumbs up ï¿½
The finest steakhouse in Dhaka. Would highly recommend their West Texan style steaks.
If you want steak, you got your place right here! The steaks were really juicy and it is done the way it is supposed to be done. Totally recommended, both for food and service.

In our visit, they served absolutely tender and juicy steaks, with well cooked grilled vegetables, real steak sauce and a bonus butter sauce! Everything was cooked to perfection. After you place the order they show you the pieces of meats/cuts - which is a great thing for the real steak lovers. The owner himself gave us briefs about all the steaks, making yourself clear about the one you are ordering. In summary, a perfect steakhouse with original recipe - highly recommended for real steak lovers!

Thanks to #foodbuzz for making a special day â€˜Super Specialâ€™! Today I want to express my gratitude to foodbuzz who unconditionally helped me create a special memory! Place : #foodbuzz ok so before I start rating their food and service and what not let me start off by saying what they did right that other restaurants usually don't. 1st - The food actually looks as they were advertised. 2nd - They actually served the food hot, yes you heard it right "HOT" this is where a lot of restaurant fails. They served all the food at the right time and in right order. ok now let's move on to what you guys really care about. Items -9/10 :kabsha, chusanut salad. Taste -9/10: I don't believe in perfection but this came pretty close, I would still rate it 9 but I gave 10 for a reason and I'll explain that in a bit. So anyway the chusanut salad really hot when it was served and it was tasty as well. Every item on that platter was upto the mark. Sorry I don't know the name of all the items otherwise I would've explained each item by their taste. Quantity: [10/10]: I don't know how much you can eat but I can eat a lot and I can tell you it's more than enough for 4 person.

Had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant on my short, but memorable trip to Dhaka almost two summers ago. The environment is clean and neat unlike the dark, dimly lit restaurants found lurking all over Dhaka city. The food and service were absolutely divine. Coming to Dhaka I realized nothing is truly authentic, you are expected to run into the fusions here. This restaurant takes the hat in asian fusion food. The exotic looking menu and the fresh quality food here was something remembered from my South Asia tour. Congratulations to the restaurant on holding their standard high over the course of the years. Locals say it's been around for more than 20 years and it shows in their service! I look forward to coming back and try those crabs again!
Environment and food was awesome.

Makes me nostalgic every time I visit this place. Have dined here since I was 4/5 years old I guess. Food is epic. Not to mention the service. Will definitely be one of my favorite places of all time. I'm giving it a 4 star because I liked the old place better, mostly because it was one of the coolest looking buildings of Dhaka (the one with the Big Red Lobster!!!). Wish you guys all the best (y)

I have been a regular customer of Gloria Jean's of Gulshan 1 and Gulshan 2 branches, since there opening at Dhaka, Bangladesh.Their caramel machiato, chillers and chiken lollipops are my all time favourites, but today It has happened. my love for gloria jeans has crossed the sky limit. I went on Gulshsn 1 branch, ordered my favourite Machiato, bought a RA mug and left it there. I contacted with them and told what happened and later there was an awesome person from that branch... named Shahid who assured me that he found the mug and asked me to collect it from the cash counter. I have told the details of the person who will collect it instead of me and guess what, i got back my mug, just because of the awesome people who are working in Gulshan 1 branch and ready to serve their customers with utmost pleasure anytime. #LovedyourService #LoveforGloriaJean's

I went there yesterday. It was a busy time. I ordered Steam rice with Steam chicken for me and Grilled chicken for my friend. Unfortunately both chicken were cold but part of the grilled chicken was very cold. I ordered Latte and at last but to be honest it was cold as well. the Waiters need to be little bit more trained as I was looking for them at least 7-10 mins to clean my table and also they should have some knowledge about the food. Overall I can not give more than 3 star this time. Hope next time I will have a more good experience. Thanks

The first glance of the place with its magnificent Lebanese inspired decorations immediately gave out an impression of the middle east. Simple yet subtle. The moment I took a bite of the kabab, I felt like I was back in the Arabian peninsula. The soft arabian music and the lightings and ofcourse the humble waiters dressed in the finest attires helped to complement the feel I suppose. They really did deliver the so called Arab "ZAYKA". If nothing else the chefs of this place are some of the finest artists in the world. A 5 star rating would not suffice to describe the experience. I offer them my compliments and look forward to their future endeavours.
I just love this place . nd the food was too good.

First of all the decoration of the place is too beautiful. It increases with the Lebanese songs. The food we ordered was happy hour set menu which was so delicious specially the chicken mushroom curry and rice. Quantity was also good for single person. The sauce needs to be better as it was slight spicy. Chicken was average. The behaviour of the staffs was not good that I experienced. I found them kinda rude. When we were selecting the food from the menu they immigrated showed us another menu and said may be we could not afford that. That was so insulting though we all stayed there to taste the food. Overall the experience was good except the behaviour of the staffs.
Definitely authentic Arabian foods, loved the ambience. Anyone who loves Arabian must try out this place
Finally I loved your Iftar platter. The place is welcoming with quality service. Keep it up! :)
the food was worth every single penny.behaviour was commendable as well.overall a good place to go with family & friends.

I'm not sure why but word around town is that this place sucks. It definitely doesn't. The kebab items, especially the shish tawuq was quite good. Condiments were nice. The only thing I'd complain about is price - it's quite expensive. A two person sharing kebab platter with drinks will easily cost you 2000 bdt or a little less than USD 30.
Interior design is sophisticated.. Tasty and healthy food...
The food was good. Environment nice. The behaviour of the stuff are quite good. Overall liked the place.
Less spicy, good ambiance, service is also good.

There was no reason to go here, specifically, as my friend and I were both on a tight schedule. He had come on a return visit to his homeland from America, and wanted to meet up, after 12 years (for him) and 20 years for me.. also looking for a place near his old house where he grew up. It was just beyond! Meeting a friend after 20 years can be a very, very surreal experience, and I am quite glad that Al-Amar helped to enclose those memories.
If you really want to taste Arabian food then this is the right place

Yaa habibi!! The hummus is divine, the tahine thick and rich, and the dÃ©cor and music all transport you to a magical Mediterranean realm. Al-Amar features a wide variety of Lebanese as well as Oriental dishes. True that the price is somewhat above the average range for restaurants in the area, but it's still within reasonable limits given the quality and portions of the food served, and the warm service received. The drinks are interestingly refreshing. We opted for the hummus and kafta antabli (lamb skewers), the ice honey tea and mint lemonade. Not disappointed at all. Very pleasant atmosphere too.

We placed an order over the phone for takeaway and were told that food would be ready in approximately 35 mins. I went after 45 mins to pick up the food and it still wasn't ready. I had to wait another 10 mins for them to prepare the parcel. Other than this setback, let's get into the food review: 1) Lamb Kabseh, priced at 645++. The meat & rice were cooked well and the portions were sufficient for 2 (provided you take some appetizers). However, I did not really like the over...whelming tomato taste. I prefer a drier kabseh with bigger portions of meat and garlic sauce but that's just my opinion. I'd rate this 2.5/5. Since it's quite pricey, I don't really recommend this. 2) Hommos, priced at 325++. Although this may sound too expensive for just mashed chickpeas with a bit of oil and mild seasoning, trust me it's worth it. Portions are more than enough to share for 2 (you can even take this for 3). Also, you can get extra bread for 20 taka each if you do run out of bread. I'd rate this 4/5. Highly recommended. 3) Lahem Bi Ajin, priced at 300++. These are mini beef keema pizzas which taste fantastic!!! Initially I was expecting a gravy dish because the description says 'marinated minced beef cooked with spices & tomatoes the traditional way' and was kinda bummed out when I saw mini pizzas but once I took a bite, I was blown away. They also give you a slice of yellow lemon (proper imported yellow lemon, and not the crap we get here which are being passed off as lemons) which adds so much to the flavor of the dish. 5/5, I'd have this everytime I go there. And since you get 8 slices, it's superb value for money for 2 people. My total bill was 1537 BDT (including 6% service charge and 15% VAT). I am quite confused as to why I had to pay service charge for a takeaway order, they definitely should remove that. Otherwise, it's not too heavy on the pocket for something different (provided you don't take the kabseh).

Environment is good, food is also tasty but you need to give more attention on your service quality, waiters are not available when we need, even they have no combination in giving service, 3-4 waiters are giving service in one table other peopleâ€™s are waiting, so you need to much improve in management, Otherwise it was pretty good ï¿½ï¿½

Had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant on my short, but memorable trip to Dhaka almost two summers ago. The environment is clean and neat unlike the dark, dimly lit restaurants found lurking all over Dhaka city. The food and service were absolutely divine. Coming to Dhaka I realized nothing is truly authentic, you are expected to run into the fusions here. This restaurant takes the hat in asian fusion food. The exotic looking menu and the fresh quality food here was something remembered from my South Asia tour. Congratulations to the restaurant on holding their standard high over the course of the years. Locals say it's been around for more than 20 years and it shows in their service! I look forward to coming back and try those crabs again!
Environment and food was awesome.

Makes me nostalgic every time I visit this place. Have dined here since I was 4/5 years old I guess. Food is epic. Not to mention the service. Will definitely be one of my favorite places of all time. I'm giving it a 4 star because I liked the old place better, mostly because it was one of the coolest looking buildings of Dhaka (the one with the Big Red Lobster!!!). Wish you guys all the best (y)

There was a time not long ago when the choice for good authentic Indian restaurant in Dhaka was limited to Sajna and Khazana only, and then came Tarka with their mind blowing "never tasted" authentic Indian menu in a casual yet classy ambiance. So far I have tried all of their lunch thalis (except Veggie and Rice, as I am not much into those), and from their regular menu mutton hyderbadi biriyani, chicken lagawab makhani, beef boti, chickten tikka, khusnama kabab, daal butter... fry, matar paneer, mughal chicken, kashmiri/butter/garlic nan and I can't rank anyone better than the other as for their quality is 5 star. As for the drinks my favorite is Jeera Pani. It's also good to see that their service level has drastically improved since their inception and now I don't mind paying the 7% service charge. Also a nice addition was their Iftar menu during Ramadan and particularly the 'haleem' which I fell in love after first sip. I have intentionally held off my review until now as I wanted to test them over time for their consistency which they have proved so far. Portion of beef is again okay though there was hardly any chicken in the chicken pizza. You can also count the olives. The overall taste was good for 200tk. But considering the toppings, 200 tk is not cheap rather an okay price tag. They only have 8 inch pizzas. For a guy like me, I could easily eat Two and go for ...a kacchi afterwards. (Not Kidding). You can give it a try but not really a place to go back just to have the pizza. Great try though. Cheers.

Love this place! They are a fine dining establishment, with really great food, great service and, as expected, a hefty price tag against every item available. Despite of the feeling of despair I get whilst paying the bill, I still managed to go there a number of times, and haven't been disappointed once However, my latest visit was yesterday, and this time around, I faced a serious problem which prompted me to write this review. We ordered "Beef Udon Noodles" which is a fav...orite of my wife, and at the very end of the dish, we found some coiled strings. These things definitely came from the wired sponges that are used for scrubbing the plates when a dish washer is not available. So the person who cleaned the plates wasn't competent, and the chef was not vigilant enough to check this before serving the dish. It wasn't a big deal, but we had a bad feeling. We kind of lost our appetite, and called in the waiter to tell this to his manager. Knowing Bangladeshi restaurants, we weren't hoping for much. However, the manager came in almost running, and profusely apologized. He wanted to replace the dish. But by then, we were full and didn't have the appetite to eat more. So I refused. Then the manager told us that he will remove the bill for the noodles, and we can have any main dish from the menu for free. When I said we are no longer hungry, he said we can also have it made for "take away". By then, I was quite surprised. I haven't really seen such behavior from any other restaurant in Dhaka. But then again, I also did not find strings in the food in any other restaurant. But that is not really the point, the point is the nice gesture shown by Umai. After declining this generous offer, the manager seemed sad and apologized again and left. After 4-5 minutes, I asked for the bill, and the waiter informed that we will be served complimentary desserts and then the bill will be given. This was something I could not refuse. So me, my wife and child totally enjoyed the free Banana Katsu dessert (which was the most expensive dessert in the menu) and came out with a satisfied mind. I hope they continue this kind of customer service and improve the kitchen vigilance. I wish them all the best as I want them to stick around and keep on serving us high quality Japanese food.
Just love this place...peaceful environment..excellent service and well behaved management! Super like! ï¿½

The salmon belly was absolutely mouthwatering, authentic japanese taste..so was the fresh salmon salad, the dish lives up to its name..the devils breath maki rolls were really good too! All in all, most of the food items are amazing and the overall food experience very good!

Food is awesome, and has some thing special which will drive you here again and again. Visited with my family and had chicken teriyaki, deep fried Seafood, fried prawn, Umai special soup with strip of loin beef and for desert banana kastu. All were very good and unique in taste. Must complement their Japanese Chef and the Umai management. All foods are imported and service is excellent as well.

My sister (cousin) recommended salmon teriyaki as I was looking for something on Salmon for long.. It was pretty good but I think they put less salt on it. Ambiance is perfect for any chaos/noise free dining with loved ones.

Such a overpriced menu! Prices are more than even Sydney :O There are lots of sushi/Bento shops around Sydney City, provides more quantities/varieties in Bento with even lesser price (around $6-$10 = BDT 350-550) Sushi long each $3-$4 (150-240 BDT) Considering cost in Sydney (place and stuff cost in Sydney at least 10 times than BD..) what would be the reason of such high price??

Far from a conventional Japanese diner, UMAI is haute to the hilt. Purely the name suggests, the menu offers widest gamut of mouth-watering delicacies, including scrumptious sea foods, zesty meats, splendiferous staples, as well as tantalizing desserts. This chiefly Japanese restaurant is one culinary casting that satiate an appetite, and worthy of repeated encores...

Let's talk about the place first. Located at the edge of Sat Masjid Road near the Dhanmondi 27 turning, which provides to be central location for people coming in from Mohammadpur, Lalmatia or Dhanmondi. While they do not have a dedicated parking place they try to make up for it by having numerous guards. Interior is very nice. Well decorated, modern and unlike some very dimly lit restaurants opening up nowadays, this proved to be a welcoming experience offering something qui...te on the contrary. The ambience is very inviting with music in the background and ample room between tables to not overhear the conversations from tables nearby. We were a family of four. After being handed the menu which had decent amount of items we ordered a standard Chinese dinner for my parents whilst me and my sister opted for something from the Indian cuisine. We had ordered more than our table of four could accumulate so were moved to a bigger table. Food was served within approximately 20 mins. The food was good, my parents seemed to enjoy the Chinese cuisine and from little of what I tasted i felt the quality was certainly there. My order of tandoori chicken was good but I felt the butter nan to be pretty dry. The owner as well as the manager came around to ask if the food was okay and I let them know of my dry experience of the nan and they immediately changed it. The second batch of nan was much better. Service proved to be admirable and quite helpful when needed. The staff behavior was excellent. All in all it was a great dining experience. A lot of the food we ordered were leftover so we packed it to take home. They gave us a promotional discount but the final bill without the discount seemed reasonable, we were actually expecting the bill to be more but pleasantly surprised. One of the managers actually walked us to our car while leaving. This feeling of exclusiveness felt great and really made you feel the restaurant is keen on delivering good food and service. Hope they are able to maintain this standard in the future. FINAL VERDICT: Location: 9/10 Interior: 10/10 Food: 10/10 Service: 10/10 Price: 9/10

Having a restaurant like this just next to my house is a blessing. We people with friends used to just hang around here & there in searching a good food place with a great environment. Then this is. We have been there consecutively 2 days and tried pizza pasta and french fries. I must say pizza was just delicious. If you can just continue keeping this quality, you will be housefull shortly. Pasta was also good. Cheesy fries wasn't up to the mark I must say. This would be be...tter if you do it by baking in oven. and the flaw I must mention is your service. Waiters are not just accustomed to the typical restaurant service. Try experienced ones. This restaurant will be great place unless you people let the quality be beaten by popularity. :)
Food was good but you've to improve your service.....
Food is too good but they need to improve their service..

Few months back when the Cafe just opened I gave a bad review for it's service....but now I have changed my review and I must say that now they have really improved their service and their food taste is also bang on...cudos to cafe meating...I live in wari and I am really happy that there is such a fine dining place in my area, surely its one of the best place to grab a meal in Wari and I hope they will hold on to their Food taste, quality and service like that. ï¿½ï¿½

Those who loves to have à¦¡à¦¾à¦²-à¦­à¦¾à¦¤ along with spicy beef, mutton or chicken, this is the best restaurant for them ! Chui (à¦šà¦‡/à¦šà§à¦‡), the mighty spice that can make you drool anywhere at any moment ! The beef/mutton/chicken pieces where big enough to fill your tummy ! The pulse and the smashed potato are good too. You can choose your own damn meat and very own piece. The service persons are well behaved. Over all a damn cozy place to have lunch or dinner with your beloved ones. Loved it.

For me it was like tasting the flavour I always liked. It was not like what I used to have in Abbas Hotel or in Satkhira or in Khulna Zero Point but its one of the places where the traditional food of Khulna region can be found here in Dhaka. It made me feel nostalgic. So, I have no complain about the environment or service :)

The beef was too good today, chicken was good enough but the mutton was not so good....it was so-so. Choi Jhal you should add at least a decent dessert for the ending... The yogurt you served was the worst dish ever and for that the ends taste which left in the mouth was the worst. You should also do something about the mutton.

26/8/2018- Absolute Thai genuine Siamese dishes 5 Starsâ­ï¸ The hot and spicy Tom yam soup with seafood was superb and it was beyond description of mere words...! Thai mango salad with crispy cat-fish was not only pleasing to the eyes but it had teased our tastebuds to the fullest as well...!... Stir-fried sliced beef with vegetables was equally good in both looks and taste...! Last but not least, even the steamed rice was fantastic and we whacked it all till the last grain...! A word of thanks to your great staff who had offered their best and impeccable service during our patronage at your outlet. Keep up the good job and we wish to have the chance to come back for more in the near future.

I just had the most amazing experience at Absolute Thai the other day. The Seheri platter is absolutely worth the money. You can have 2 platters only at BDT 850++ and the food is really delicious. Really liked the Chicken Satay and the Prawn Tempura. The Mango sticky rice was a bit weird but really yummy. Way to go Absolute Thai. Going to visit you soon again!

Yes i liked the food. But only thing so far i found totally absurd was the price of the local pepsi can which was 75tk 250ml which must not be more than 40tk highest, i myself buy "imported" pepsi or coke for 80tk, so for imported 330ml cans if you put the price over 100tk still i don't mind... but i am not bound to pay local 30-35tk cans for 75tk at least. It has nothing to do with service charge or any other expense, so no excuse please. One or two waiters need to know the basics before packing the left over foods as well.

Disappointed ï¿½ I absolutely (#punintended) love to find faults when I'm at restaurants so that I can bash them on their facebook page. But sadly, their food tasted great and their service was actually nice. Unfortunately, they even replaced my red beef curry when they found out I was allergic to aubergine. I was also highly disappointed by their constantly smiling faces. So with great regret I am giving them 5 stars.

The DECOR of the place is absolutely simple. Nothing very fancy or bright, it's aristocratic. Everyone is well behaved & very welcoming. The DISHES we ordered were the almost regular Thai dishes which was served rather quick in different unique pots & plates. The aroma was spot on from every dish, as you put the Soup, soaked dim sim or even fried sea bass in your mouth it would just give you the burst of correct flavours. The PRICES seemed reasonable for 1:3 main dishes, 1:1 appetizers and deserts.

This is my visit to "Absolute Thai". I am very impressed to have excellent mouth watering dishes. Ambiance is very nice and service is appreciable. On the other side, price are a bit high. Anyway, I wish Absolute Thai a great success in business.

Today i had lunch there with some of my friends. The food tasted good as a whole, took Tom yum soup and mixed fried rich with morning glory, chicken hot besil leaf, fish garlic pepper. That was really very nice. Thai lemon mint & lemon grass was simply mouthwatering. Usually for us Bangladeshies, chinese and thai aren't really different. Because we take the cuisine and tailor it in our own way which doesn't leave much of aurhenticity or difference. And we prefer it rather than the original taste as it is spice laced enough to please our tastebud. But, this restaurant lives up to its name and surprisingly the authentic food tastes much much better than our BD style chinese/thai! Overall it was a good experience...

The food tasted good as a whole, but I didn't like the mixed fried rice; to be very specific, it lacked seasoning, and had lumps of rice, which were not stir fried properly; the overdoneness came from the oozing mix of dark soya sauce. The Seafood Tom tum and chicken in coconut milk soups were tasty, but I've definitely tasted better flavoured ones in Dhaka. The prawn cakes tasted like store bought frozen ones, they were quite rubbery, the chicken satays tasted good. Chicken... with cashew nut, beef chilli and Fish with black pepper sauce were good, but nothing to be over-hyped about, as Dhaka has seen a vast number of restaurants serving Authentic Thai cuisine. The interior and service both were pleasant. I personally feel they still have space for improvement in their cooking techniques. Overall it was a good experience, my family was happy at the end of the day, and that's the most important thing.

I would not recommend this place to a friend.

Just had an Absolute Feast with my family at Absolute Thai! Started off the evening with the Mixed Appetizers which was great while we waited (considering that it was a packed Friday night, it did take time, but also gave us the chance to chat). The food was brilliant, and 3 hours later, I am still full and can barely move. The Coconut soup with Seafood was my personal favourite! Supplemented by the Dim Sum, an item that appeared to be a Thai Fuchka and Thai Fishcakes dipped... in a Creamy Garlic Sauce, it was a great opener. We ordered loads of items but the Pad Thai, Red prawn and the Chicken with Green Curry particularly stood out. We ended the evening with the (sweet) Lemon Grass juice and the infamous Sticky Rice with Mango (which really lived upto its hype). The restaurant itself is cozy, comfortable, illimunaited and has a classy feel without trying hard. This place is a must for anyone looking for fine dining with quality Thai food.

Not bad! It is fancy enough and I thought might be pretty expensive. But I would say quantity is good enough against price. Food is decent too. Liked what I ordered except Sticky Mango Rice. Kudos for the quantity they serve on dishes again!

Probably the best buffet restaurant for dinner in Dhanmondi in terms of food quality and variety, price and ambience with a few small shortcomings that you'd do well to be prepared for. The buffet begins at your table with "starters" i.e. the day's bbq served at your table - chicken, fish and mutton with naan, which is refilled as you finish the serving. Although the waiters claim that the starters are "un-limited", after you've asked for a refill twice, service slows down an...d the waiters begin to discourage you from asking for more refills by repeatedly telling you that the bbq is only a starter and that you can now try the main buffet. It might get annoying, but as I found out, it's not bad advice since the buffet is quite good. The main dishes aren't the same old buffet dinner fare you see over and over again, but different and tasty. Their chicken biryani, creamy chicken and lemon fish in particular were really good. The chicken soup and chicken basil leaf were a little too salty though. The others - onion prawn, shahi paneer, beef etc were good. Among their deserts, their shahi tukra and brownie were good while the others - bread pudding, firni, fruit etc were just plain. However, they also serve kulfi! It wasn't out of the world, but hey - it's kulfi! Overall, definitely a place I'd recommend for dinner. And if you take my advice - don't try to get all your money's worth from the bbq alone; save it for the buffet, it's worth it. P.S. the menu changes from day to day, and so might your experience there.
Nice place... foods, and acoomodation are really good.

This is my second visit to the restaurant. I went there for lunch. This time i found little poor service. The bbq they served on table was only limit to chicken, fish and pineapple. After the second serve of bbq the waiters were rushing us to start buffet. When we started buffet the waiters where rushing to cleanup and to serve desserts. This is very annoying. In main course they have very limited items including beef biryani. As i don't eat beef the option became more less for me. But overall still i am satisfied.
Reasonable price however 15% VAT and 10% service charge will be added to the bill.

Main dish is rubbish comparing to quality and quantity with other buffet restaurant. Good variety of starters and main courses, but limited variety of desserts. Probably the best dining option in that area, which is quite important given the traffic in Dhaka. Only the buffet option is available, which is not convenient if you want to order something specific for a smaller amount, but overall the value for money is quite adequate. Drinks are not included in the buffet price.
Excellent food, beautiful interior, outstanding service.
I loved their starter and desert!! ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ way too good.....!!!

It was nice, felt like an overseas buffet restaurant. The built-in BBQ grill table with unlimited kebabs is their main attraction. For starters, they served chicken boti, mutton shish, fish, Indian paneer & potato kebabs. I loved the chicken kebab most, it was well marinated with yogurt and spices. Other than that, they had chicken corn soup, papadums, chutneys & lots of salads. The main course had a rather small but good selection of dishes. The Hyderabadi biryani was nice b...ut the meat wasn't tender enough and it was made from "mixed cuts". I also liked the beef chili (bhuna), fish with lemon grass, prawn with tomato & basil and shahi paneer (similar to korma). There were only four dessert items with unlimited kulfi. The buffet price (Tk.1200) doesn't include VAT or any drinks. Overall, it would be better if they could include mutton boti kebab for starters and expand the menu for main course & dessert items.

We got Great experience, friendly behavior, fantastic environment & most important thing is unique & delicious food !! Keep it up

From the outside it doesn't look much but its a different story once you step inside. Quite well decorated with comfortable sitting arrangements. Went there first time during for Iftar + dinner. The highlights of the menu were the whole lamb, whole fish, lasagna and teriyaki chicken. The lamb was well marinated and soft, while the fish was also equally marinated. The lasagna was exceptionally good specially for a buffet Iftar menu. One other thing which I liked was the live grilling station serving minute steaks, prawns and grilled mackerels. The staff were quite attentive, quickly clearing out our plates during the buffet and checked with us if food was ok or if we need anything else. Hope they can keep up the level of quality and service
This meal was very tasty. I want to go again and again.

Letâ€™s talk about service: in one word awesome, the quality of food was really good and mouthwatering. The environment was really nice. I liked the BBQ part itâ€™s really well cooked and juicy. Must visit this place for their quality food, hospitality and environment. Shaw's Steakhouse has already won acknowledgements and certifications for itâ€™s quality food, service & environment. Wish them all the very best in future.

First thing that i look when i reach an eatery is a parking spot, even though Shaw is located near a very busy exit but their outdoor personnel efficiently managed and secured me a good parking spot. The decor and the ambience is very luxurious but entering the place made me feel awkward as i found the restaurant staffs (waiters) themselves sitting at guest chairs and watching TV. They couches are very cozy to sit but i also think they congested the place with too much sittin...g arrangement. They should have left more free space for free movement even though they have such a big floor. Their food quality is excellent, the steaks were perfectly marinated and cooked to perfect flavors and temperature, the taste and the look shows that dishes are cooked delicately here. However the portion is the issue!! I think the servings are not adequate, even the pictures taken of the food on the plate looks poor. I think the main courses served should have the standard portion Quantity that any other fine dining offers. The Manager was a very nice gentlemen. And the waiter who served us was also very attentive and gentle. Also charging 15Tk only for the bottled water was cool !!
I was always bit confused when someone asked me, which is the best steak place in city. now i can proudly say.. shaws steak is the best place to have steak. best ambience, best food, best service.

If I go for honest reviews I am a die hard steak fan.. for which I keep on experimenting trying steaks at different places, wont go into direct comparison but I can assure you their steaks and dessert are the best out there. Point to be added this is the perfect place for well off dinner. Need a second visit out there :) Ambiance:9/10 Quality:8.5/10 Service:10/10 Price: good things cost you a bit

My student was asking me for the past year to meet up with him near his old house. I just couldn't make any time, until today. :( :) I looked up the food places near Taj Mohol road, Dhaka on Google maps, and it was the same old same old, BFC/KFC/Pizza Hut BS. I didn't want to go to any of them. I wanted to try some place new. As I kept searching a little marker stood in one far north-west corner of the map. It read Bell Pattio. I called my student and we met up nearby, only t...o be greeted by an exhausted employee in a small lone, gloomy room of a restaurant. I wondered all the time whether they actually served anything at all. The exhausted employee asked us if we wanted the works, to which we simply replied "sure". The Pizza arrived in 10min. It was the fastest pizza order I ever received in town. And it was superb! I recommend all to come here at least once if not more, in their lifetime. 5/5

My friend and I wanted to try this place after seeing a review on Instagram. It was a little difficult to find since neither of us had been to Shakhertak. We ordered a Meat Lovers Supreme. The pizza arrived in 15-18 mins, piping hot. It was the kind of pizza one would find at a restaurant like Pizza Hut, which was a pleasant surprise. It does say "Beef and Chicken" in the pizza description but they came in sausage form and not their usual form. This was a bit unusual but not a bad idea. The dough was fresh, there was a good amount of cheese, the service was good, and the price was very very reasonable. I hope they continue doing what they're doing because it's working. I hope to visit them once again soon.

I ordered a 12" bel piatto meat lovers pizza! and surprisingly 6" pizza was free with this 12" pizza *___* They just took 30 minutes to delivery the pizza ï¿½ It was so goood <3 loved it <3 Price :650 taka only :D

I want to thank pizza hut chittagong CDA Ave (near bus stop) for extraordinary service. We were travelling from CTG to Dhaka. We ordered a pizza and said that our bus will leave in 5 mins, can u make it? They said they ll deliver if they cant. So time ran out and our bus was leaving, so we hurriedly went for the bus and asked them to cancel the order. Our bus started and we were upset that pizza hut couldnâ€™t provide our food. Suddenly the bus stopped and a pizza hut delivery guy came in with our pizza. We were shocked! He chased the bus to deliver our pizza. This shows amazing customer service from them. Thank u again and special thanks to the delivery guy.

Let's get one thing clear. A restaurant like Chows has two things to offer. Cuisine and service. Food is great. Proportions are not. Service not good at all. After all the reviews about their service being not up to mark, i was a bit skeptical. But i was really surprised to find their service top of the line. They were very humble and veryyy nice. every person who came to our table and served us food had a big smile and they really do make u feel good about ordering and eating there. The food was just next level. My friends finished most of the appetizers by the time i was there but the 1s i did get to try were mind blowing. also ...their sauces are out of this world (especially this black bean sauce). i do not remember the name of the items but we had a fish a beef a chicken and noodles. each of them were perfect in their own way although i thought the noodles cud improve a wee bit. the fish (fish with black beans think) was the best. we all thoroughly loved the meal but my friends kept saying the appetizers (which i misssed) were better than the main course. Overall it was a great experience. i simply loved it. oh and the place is gorgeous and very well maintained. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Had a dinner reservation for 3 and after reading several of the reviews on the page and suggestions from family and friends, decided to have a Dim Sum night. Placed 6 orders of various Dim Sums. The first one to arrive was the Steamed Spicy Glass Noodle Dumplings which were average, not my preference. I was quite taken away by the Steamed Mushroom and Herb Dumplings, sort of reminded me of the mushroom momos from Crepe o Momo. That's the end of vegetarian dishes and now my fa...vorite, the meat dim sums. The Chicken and Prawn Sui Mai were tasty, a little hot and would order again. The Beef Cheung Fung looked tastier than it really was. A friend described the taste as a savoury lychee. On the other hand the Crispy Prawn Cheung Fung was the highlight of the night and ended up ordering two of those. The last order was a Prawn and Water Chestnut Dumplings which I devoured with complete satisfaction. At the end of the night, I was full and content. To accompany the dim sum was still water, and service was normal, nothing extraordinary. Overall good dining experience, loved the decor and would visit again.

I lived japan two years. That time i was falling in love for Sushi. Every weekend I ate lot of sushi. Last year i came back to bd, and thought in my entire life i will not eat sushi as good as sushi meijin in japan. But I was surprised to eat shamon sushi in Tokyo express, that was exactly same taste like sushi meijin in japan. But honestly speaking it is too expensive than japan, whereas japan was one of the most expensive country in the world, Thier food cost, labour cost is too high. But In bd why sushi price is too expensive compare to rice and beef sysling I don't understand. Whatever the sushi was too good. I am so happy to have it.

Decided to pay Tokyo Express a visit - took us few minutes to find the place. If you are coming from Gulshan-Banani Brdige-end Just do a left on Road 9 then take the first right. Restaurant is on the ground floor and before you reach the main entrance you pass a few tables occupied by mostly university student types and smokers. As I went in, first thing I noticed is that the restaurant has very poor acoustics and was very loud - specially the inside rooms. I asked the Waite...r to explain the menu as he did, I was unable to understand half of what he said - problem with both his English and Bangla pronunciation. The decor was average, Steel cutleries already showing wear and narrow ends of chopsticks are worn out â€“ the shiny coating has come off exposing the wood like material. Tokyo Express should provide disposable or better quality chopsticks as micro food particles can easily stick to the exposed material. We were just given one small empty sauce bowl for our soy sauce/wasabi mix to dunk our sushi - there were two of us and they should have given us two sauce bowl as I personally do not like to share my sauce bowl with others. We ordered the the assorted sushi dish, Chicken Nanban and Osaka spicy beef and fried rice. The Sushi tasted quite good 2 pieces each - of prawn, cuttlefish and salmon. The sushi rice could be of better quality. This would make the sushi extremely good. Chicken Nanban is an average dish but was quite delicious. Made with ice cube sized chicken breast pieces on a light sauce. Sauce tasted like Oyster sauce with soy sauce and sugar added in. A very plain dish. Osaka spicy beeft also tasted very nice - dry shredded beef cooked in hot and light teriyaki sauce and spring onion. The dish was quite tasty. Fried rice also tasted nice but seemed just a tad bit oily. Cooked in less oil the dish would taste just as good. The watermelon juice was average; it was naturally sweet but lacked body and volume. Bill was just above Taka 2000. For the price Tokyo express is a good value with decent food. Although I was not wowed by any of the dishes, I was not disappointed either. Definitely recommended for sushi (at least for the price) and casual lunch and dinner. The menu choice is very limited; I would advice the owners to add more items. >M.M
We took the Chicken Canban(?),Sushi,Osaka (?) Beef, Giant Prawn Tempura and Tokyo Fried Rice.Food was good,liked it.The chicken was best!

Great food. Imbuing dishes with a seasonal feel and bringing out the natural flavors of the ingredients are very important parts of this style of Japanese cuisine......Tokyo Express successfully done it. The restaurant- wait staff are all very polite and treat diners with exceptionally thoughtful hospitality.Their deep admiration of the seasons and warm thoughtfulness towards the customer reflects a sense of aesthetics that prizes tranquility and simplicity.

I don't know what happened 4 months ago with all these negative reviews. Sbarro had always been my most favorite pizzeria in Bangladesh. I'm almost a regular in this shop. I'm a big fan of their Gulshan outlet. Tobay I visited their Bailey Road outlet. Mr. Masud Rana served me all the way with kind and good professionalism. I ordered 1 NY cheese, 1 NY chicken tikka, 1 NY hot & spicy and 2 Iced lemon tea (My all time favourite). All of them tasted really good. Specially the NY... hot & spicy (Definitly recommended). Sbarro always served the most fresh dough or crust. It felt soft and well baked. They use just the amount of cheese the pizza needs. They do well with the pizza sauce they use. Perfect tasting pepperoni. Well seasoned. Not everyone is going to love all of the pizza flavours. But I think you'll definitly find one you'd love. I have jsut a small issue with the Iced lemon tea. Except mohammadpur and maybe dhanmondi outlet, I've been to every other one. In the original Gulshan outlet they use huge beer mugs for the Iced lemon tea. But in some other outlets you'll find them using thin narrow glasses to serve the lemon tea which is sad. And the taste varries from outlet to outlet. The taste is like a hit or miss. They should try to fix that. And I liked the fact that only they had their one signature 18" sized pizzas in BD. I hated it when they started introducing different sizes for their pizza. Well, it's just me complaining. Happy feasting.

It was our first visit to Sbarro, Mohammadpur branch... The first thing that impressed us was the hospitality of the staffs, specially Mr.Sunny... This all-time smiley faced person was very polite and friendly... We ordered Stuffed Crust Pizza with sausages and pepperoni and Iced Tea... Pizza was delicious and juicy and the Iced Tea was simply awesome... Thanks to Sbarro Bangladesh for giving us the original taste of Sbarro... :-)

I often visit SBARRO Uttara, and they have amazing service! Itâ€™s easily my favourite pizzeria in Bangladesh. The manager is extremely nice and generous! He even offered us some complimentary extra food. If you have time and are looking for great food, great service, and an amazing environment, definitely come here!

I went to the mohammadpur branch before the opening day only to try out the pizza. They said only 4 pizzas were available,the rest will come after 5th October,the opening day. So we had a pizza which was available and it was good. Then they provided us with some coupons and told that we'll get 20% discount on these items till 15th October. Then again we went there after the day of opening and showed them the coupon but the servers said that those items were not available. The...y also said if I want to use these coupons and want to have that meal I have to go to another outlet as the mohammadpur outlet didn't have those meals. I mean it is already opened! Why does it still don't have combos and other things available? Every outlet has launched together so every outlet should also have same pizzas and other items available! You guys should take care of that. Otherwise the pizza was good.

Tried out almost every slice of the pizza available on the menu today. The item Signature Stuffed Crust - Chicken and Broccoli was the best of all with its beautiful aroma and cooking style. i will give Sbarro the highest rating of all the pizza places I have ever been. And thanks to Staff member Miss Ranu Chowdhury for serving us with honor. Appreciate the good behavior and asking for our feedback. In a word, the food was good indeed. Totally worth it. And also I would like ...to add an extra suggestion in the end. The VAT is okay But I have never seen to take service charges from the customers or billing with VAT and SC or DC whatever. I would recommend that as the pizza prices are a bit high, so why not include or adjust the extra charges with the item prices. I hope this review would be taken into account seriously. Thank you. Signed by Tushar Chowhan

Went to Sbarro Bangladesh Yesterday after reading all d positive and negative reviews. We were late and started thinking to go another place,suddenly a person came and we started requesting him as we were very exited to taste their pizzas specially d cholate dessert ï¿½. We thought he will start with sorry but we were really surprised when he offered us to stay there. He took us to d the first floor in d same building arranged a table to sit till ifter and promised us to give t...he first table after d ifter.And we got d table after 1 hour of ifter.It's true We started having pizza after 1 hour but we did not miss anything.They served all d flavours one after another. So service should be like ds.Thank you so very much Sbarro Bangladesh for d hospitality. Thanks to the operation head Ehsanul Kabir . And we are really Thankful to Shaojib vai who served our table.Thanks man u did a great job. Nice Environment Quality ï¿½ Great Service Freindly Behaviour. **By the way they served us ifter also**

This is my first review. Went to Sbarro Bangladesh last week! If you are a pizza lover then you should definitely go there. So they serve 7 kinds of pizza . And I'm rating them according to how it tasted to me ... So here it goes. 1. Super supreme : 8/10 2. NY chicken Tikka: 9.5/10 3. NY cheese : 9/10 4. NY spicy beef: 8.5/10 5. Chicken Italian sausage :8/10 6. NY mushroom pizza : 7.5/10 7. Chocolate dessert pizza :8/10 Environment: 10/10 Everyone was absolutely well behaved. The atmosphere was energetic mostly cuz the game was going on. NB: the ratings above are based on my personal experience. It may vary from taste to taste.
Excellent service,food and environment! One of the best stuffs! Loved all the pizza's especially the chocolate one! Hope to visit again when you guys open in uttara! ï¿½

We were 6 people yesterday and it was all our first time trying unlimited pizza and we're glad it was at Sbarro. The pizzas were quite good, but the service provided to us by Mr. Sajib was even better, which over all made it a good experience for us.

I guess they serve the best pizza in Dhaka and the fillings on the pizza were too delicious. More over, their service was too good. We got Shojib & Kakoli who served us really well & with their generous hospitality behaviour made us feel like home. We took unlimited pizza offer. As usual NY cheese, NY mushroom & chicken tikka hold their top position in my favorite list. Keep it up Sbarro. Good news: Sbarro is launching 8 more branches around Dhaka city soon. So, it's a request to Sbarro team, please always try to maintain the same quality as they are now. Cause many renowned pizza restaurants have degraded their quality gradually for profit.
well i decided to give you 4 star but for MR.SHAJIB'S service I put 1 extra star here. and pizza was amazing as always.

very good pizza indeed. but what I liked most is their service. They are really polite. particularly the one who served us Mr. Sajib was very well mannered. as we came late they offered us to eat till 11 pm, which was a very nice gesture. hope to visit sbarro again. :D

So no complaints about the food which was excellent or the price which I found reasonable. But the staff have massive problems communicating with the customer or operating the sales counters. So this afternoon I head in, the place is nearly empty and I ask for a stromboli that isnt vegetables based. Four different staff offer me three kinds of vegetable based stromboli for ten minutes before one of them realizes I want a meat based stromboli and apologizes that they don't ha...ve any, wasting 10 minutes of my life. Then I head to the counter to pay, at which point the girl behind the counter presses buttons on the computer for several minutes before realising that the counter doesn't work. She apologizes. I ask her if I should go to my seat and wait for them to bill me or whether I should leave the note with her and wait for them to give me the change. She apologizes, I repeat my question. Other waiters join her in apologizing. A small crowd of apologetic waiters gather around me as I ask my question seven times and get seven rounds of apologies from more and more waiters. Then someone figures out that they can open the counter with the key that's next to the counter. At which point they take my Tk 500 note and give me my 30 Tk in change in three torn 10Tk notes, all three of which were scotch taped down the centre. At this point I should have known better than to ask, but I went ahead and asked for a pizza sauce to go with the pizza. I recieved three boxes of chilli powder/paprika from four different waiters before someone figured out what sauce was. 2/10 for service.

Wish could give a higher rating !!! We had an office party there on 22 Dec 17 of 30 guests. We needed separate seating arrangements for gents and ladies with different aged kids. They just did what I wanted. Even they kept one separate room for mothers who need to feed their babies. As it was Christmas season, so the hall was superbly decorated. The seating arrangement was not that quite but sufficiently spacious. About food, they were exceptional in case of choosing items i...n comparison to other hotels who offer the buffet of the same price range. They did not have 2/3 types Biriyani/ Rice items or any other similar food. There was no duplication of any menu. Starter items like soup and other snacks were not typical and were delicious. Ther main attractions were Small Lobster and Beef Steak. In addition to that, they had seafood and fish items too. They had variety in dessert items which we could not try as we were almost full then. We never saw an empty dish there. Whenever it was finished they refilled it without any further delay.They maintained high standard food quality throughout. If I don't say about two persons in this review then it will be an injustice to them which I must not do. Our party was a successful one only because of Restaurant Manager Mr. Zilhaj Parvez. He made everything in a way that we all felt like home. He was always there to fulfill our every requirement. Along with him, mess waiters were also very polite and professional with a smiling face. Another person is Md. Tazul Islam, Senior Security Officer, and an Ex Military person who ensured our tension free foodie time. As there was a shortage of underground parking, we had to park our cars outside. But this man ensured us about the security and was there with his troops till last maintaining extreme professional attitude. At last, all of us came out from there with a smiley face and satisfied heart. We all will look forward to going there time and again. Hope they keep their standard up always.

UNFORTUNATE ROACH INCIDENT: Good things first... I went there this summer thinking about their mango faludas which was highly recommended by ppl whose food accumen I trust... And man was I pleased! But unfortunately among the other things I ordered like their Larb Gai & the Grilled Chicken with sesame sauce which were great btw... I also ordered bowl of their Spicy Noodles and as soon as I tossed it once to cool it I noticed a tiny roach lying dead among other ingredients, which immediately killed my appetite to eat or revisit Fools Diner anymore... Recommendation for their owners: Get better lighting for the kitchen to be able to inspect your food before you serve it.
